Comment: Yep. I'm waiting to see if my visa application has been accepted so that I can move out of here, but it's not easy. I love this country. I'm watching my neighbors turn into full-blown Nazis, shouting some of the most blatantly unconstitutional shit I've ever heard, all while claiming they are the ones who truly love America. They're fine with Trump destroying the US' reputation globally, even if that means we can't afford anything anymore, even if it makes all of us significantly worse off.   I feel helpless to stop our descent into fascism, as nothing I've ever done has enacted real change. The politicians don't listen to us. My votes don't matter, even in small, local elections. I'm just so tired. So, so tired.

Comment: Do you understand how soft power works?  Do you understand that Trump has disassembled the mechanisms for applying it?  When the US steps out of the arena for 4 years, other people will step in other countries will step in. You lose the connections and the power and those take time to rebuild. And they may not be able to be rebuilt if China comes in and starts filling in the gaps we have left.  The experienced people lost. The faith in the American promise to foreign nations is crumbling.  Right now DOGE is trying to shut down the Millennium challenge corporation, which is a government agency that does international development. The agreements they have with foreign nations to provide funds and guidance are treaties.   Trump and DOGE are breaking treaties with foreign nations. These are things that take years of planning to even start  implementation, and then years to implement.  If you shut down the agency, everyone in that needs to find another job, most of them aren't coming back.  Would you trust the government again if your career is gone?   To rebuild USAID, The Millennium challenge corporation, and a variety of these other agencies is not going to be a fast process.   It's going to take more than 4 years of a democratic president, and it may potentially take a generation.  And if we keep pulling the crap we keep pulling, over the next 3 years do you think It's possible that we won't be the world's reserve currency in the future?

Comment: Soft power effects other countries policies, it influences how well countries respond to US international policies, and it can prevent political and economic rivals from gaining power.   The US is economic powerhouse, but we are burning goodwill, losing influence, and very realistically opening up avenues for our economic rivals to make stronger gains than previously possible.  If we have three more years of backwards progress, without the soft power mechanism to smooth things over we very well could lose our position as the reserve currency, for both political and economic reasons.   The British in 1870 thought that they were going to stay on top forever too.
